page.title: 13EMPLOYMENT
page.content: THE{NAIL TRADE}WAS RECORDED AS EARLY AS 1332 AND OUTCROPS OF{COAL}WERE MINED TO PRODUCE FUEL FOR THIS TRADE. DURING THE EARLY YEARS OF THE 18TH CENTURY PEOPLE BEGAN TO CALL THEMSELVES{'COLLIERS'}AND THE FLETCHERS SANK TWO SHAFTS IN 1776. AROUND THIS TIME THE{COTTON INDUSTRY ALSO BECAME ESTABLISHED AND THE{NUT {AND BOLT INDUSTRY}DEVELOPED TO SERVE THE INDUSTRIAL REVOLUTION. THE {POPULATION}AT THIS TIME, 1880, WAS GIVEN AS 11,975. {THE WORST MINING {DISASTER}IN THE AREA WAS IN 1910 WHEN 333 WERE KILLED AT THE{PRETORIA PIT. 1966 SAW THE CLOSURE OF THE LAST COAL MINE IN ATHERTON, IT ENDED NEARLY 200 YEARS OF COAL MINING BY{THE FLETCHER {FAMILY.}(CONTINUED ON PAGE 14)
